description.p: Presenting the most beautiful acrobatic technique by day, silently killing by night. These are the traits for Dhari. Presenting beautiful choreographies with their signature weapon, sometimes infused by the elements. Dhari are trained in Zuiburg.
A Dhari can do both, entertain and kill. Even in the same moment. Dhari wield a specific weapon they choose like no other, becoming one with their weapons and creating unique techniques.

When deciding to play a Dhari, think about what led your character to the live of a morderous acrobat. Maybe just like to play with your signature weapon, or your character was in a circus. How did your character come to be an adventurer? The call of presenting your acrobatics to the world?

You can make a Dhari quickly by following these suggestions. First, Dexterity should be your highest ability score, followed by Charisma and Constitution. Second, select the Charlatan or Entertainer background.
As a Dhari, you gain the following class features

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Dhari level after 1st
Weapons: Shortsword, daggers, darts, quarterstaffs, sickles, slings
Skills: Choose four from Acrobatics, Athletics, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, Performance, Persuasion, Sleight of Hand, and Stealth

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a burglar's pack, (b) a entertainer's pack or (c) a explorer’s pack

tr.td: Fleet Footwork, Jack of all Trades

sheet.description: A highly artistic wielder of a signature weapons.

description.p: At 1st level, you learn to be very agile. While you are not using a shield, you can choose to have your AC equal 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.
Additionally, you gain a +10 bonus on your movement speed.

sheet.description: While you are not using a shield, you can choose to have your AC equal {{ac:fleetfootwork}}.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn’t already include your proficiency bonus.

At 2nd level, you learned to infuse your weapons with the power of your soul. On reading your (signature) weapons you may choose to infuse them with an element of your choice. Attacks using Elemental Strike are considered magical and deal additional damage of the choosen element according to the Dhari table. You can activate this feature up to an amount equal to your charisma modifier. You regain all expended uses after a long rest. First you can choose between Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison and Thunder. Starting with 11th level you can also choose Force, Radiant and Necrotic.

sheet.description: On reading your weapons you may choose to infuse them with an element of your choice (Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Thunder). Attacks using Elemental Strike are considered magical and deal additional {{charisma:modifier}} damage of the choosen element.

description.p: At 3rd level, you choose an archetype that you strive to express in your combat styles and techniques. You may choose between different signature weapons. Chakrams or a Nodachi. Your archetype grants you techniques at 3rd level and again at 9th in addition to a damage increase at 11th level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, when an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack’s damage against you.

sheet.description: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can halve the attack’s damage against you.

description.p: Beginning at 7th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon’s fiery breath or an ice storm spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

sheet.description: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

description.p: By 11th level, you have refined your chosen skills until they approach perfection. Whenever you make an ability check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10. Additionally, your damage dice for the Chakram weapon changes to a d8.

sheet.description: Whenever you make an ability check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

description.p: Starting at 13th level, once per turn you can reroll a missing attack. Since the chakram makes another attemped on it's way back to you.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, if you are able to hear, you are aware of the location of any hidden or invisible creature within 10 feet of you.

sheet.description: If you are able to hear, you are aware of the location of any hidden or invisible creature within 10 feet of you.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, you catch any chance to strike back. When a hostile creature misses a attack against you, you can take your reaction to attack that creature. You attack with every weapon in your hand, main hand and off-hand.

sheet.description: When a hostile creature misses a attack against you, you can take your reaction to attack that creature. You attack with every weapon in your hand, main hand and off-hand.

description.p: Starting at 17th level, nothing can impair your ability to perform. You can ignore all sources of disadvantage on any of your attack rolls, ability checks, or saving throws.

sheet.description: You can ignore all sources of disadvantage on any of your attack rolls, ability checks, or saving throws.

description.p: Beginning at 18th level, you are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren’t incapacitated.

sheet.description: No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren’t incapacitated.

description.p: By 20th level, you reached a certain point of perfection with your skills. Once per Turn, if your attack misses a target within range, you can redo the attack roll. Alternatively, if you fail an ability check/saving throw you may reroll once. Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18 or higher.

description.p: The Chakra-Dhari uses bladed discs called Chakram. Special techniques are the Double Punch, Spinner and the Ricochet.
When you engage in two-weapon fighting with two Chakrams, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

sheet.description: When you engage in two-weapon fighting with two Chakrams, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

description.p: At 3rd level, you learned some important techniques. As your attack action you may use Double Punch or Spinner. At 9th level you learn the superior technique Ricochet.
You regain any expended uses when you finish a Short Rest.

sheet.description: As the cost of two of your attack action, you may use Double Punch or Spinner. You have to wield two Chakrams.
As the cost of two of your attack action, you may use Double Punch, Spinner or Ricochet. You have to wield two Chakrams.

description.p: At 11th level, you learn to use your Chakrams more precisely. Your Chakram deals a d8 slashing damage instead of a d6.

description.p: You can attack one target in melee range with both Chakrams at the same time to deal the damage of them both. You use one attack roll for this attack. On a hit, the target does a strength save against 8 + your proficiency bonus + your dexterity modifier. On a failed save, you knock the target prone.

description.p: You can spin your Chakrams around you to hit any target within 10 feet of you. Make two attack roll for each target as of they may be hit twice. If there is an obstacle blocking the way of your Chakram, it drops and can't fly further. After using this technique you may move without provoking opportunity attacks.

description.p: You’ve learnt the famous Chakra-Dhari technique to hit multiple targets by ricocheting your chakram. You can use your attack action to make two ranged attack with your chakrams against one target. If your attack hits, then any number of additional creatures of your choice within 10 feet of that target must make a Dexterity saving throw against 8 + your proficiency bonus + your dexterity modifier. Each creature that fails the save takes the same amount of damage as your first target. Additionally, you can attack targets that are not in your line of sight, such as around corners.

When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a Nodachi, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.
